required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study Evaluating Long-Term Safety and Effectiveness of Humira in Patients With Hidradenitis Suppurativa
clinical_study.official_title: Special Drug Use-Results Survey of Evaluating Safety and Effectiveness of Humira in Long Term Treatment in Patients With Hidradenitis Suppurativa

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety and effectiveness of Humira in patients with Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS) in real-world clinical practice in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who reported any serious infections during the study
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with incidence of serious infections are reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who reported any adverse drug reactions (ADRs) during the study
primary_outcome.description: ADRs will be coded by Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) dictionary.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who reported any infections during the study
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with incidence of infections are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants achieving "Improved" of overall improvement by physician
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving overall improvement (improved, unchanged, impossible to evaluate) is assessed by physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants achieving Hidradenitis Suppurativa Clinical Response (HiSCR)
secondary_outcome.description: HiSCR is defined as at least 50% reduction in the number of abscesses and inflammatory nodules and no increase in abscess count and no increase in draining fistula count relative to baseline.
CRP values are measured as an inflammatory parameter. Low CRP values mean less inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient's global assessment of skin pain
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's global assessment of skin pain is evaluated on a 11-point scale with 0 for "no pain" and 10 for "worst skin pain imaginable."

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
secondary_outcome.description: DLQI is a 10-question validated dermatologic disease questionnaire to measure quality of life.

arm_group.description: Participants who along with their treating physician have elected for treatment with Humira as per routine clinical practice for the treatment of HS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have been prescribed Humira by their treating physician as per routine clinical practice for the treatment of HS.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants previously treated with Humira.
- Participants who do not provide consent.

overall_contact.last_name: AbbVie GK Clinical Trial Registration Desk
